snippet.title: Blessed to have monster spider in house
snippet.content: RE THE Coast's biggest spider (Daily, July 28). How lucky you both are to have this beautiful huntsman spider being a member of your household. It works for you day and night hunting out any beastly bugs and other enemies. So your home is blessed as it's his home too. It won't bite you so just admire it and say a few kind words each day. As for your friend's advice about moving home or flamethrowers, disregard their suggestions - totally unworthy. Keep your 'other' family member as long as you can, he's (maybe she's) a vital part of our so vital environment. Best of luck. DAVID KENT Buderim This is how early you need to be at the airport now. Family face life in limbo EVERY mum wants to see their child live a long, happy life Architect of a region stops briefly on his final journey. Maleny open day throws spotlight on theatre groups The popular comedian brings her latest show to the Sunshine Coast The Voice winner Judah Kelly announces national tour. I guess everything was impressive as I grew up in Eudlo. OUR family was part of the first wave of sea changers. A place for lovers of good food and wine to gather WE were the first building to open in Sunshine Plaza. GREAT venues and great people. MEMORIES of Surfair, Thommo's and Stewart's. The house featured on TV series Grand Designs Australia in 2014 What your money will get you in the Beef Cap v the capital city: Prime block lays dormant for decade in Coast town Rental vacancies disappear as Coast heads for boom
